definition: (Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

sentences.english: The third part is Introduce and Reference of the Foreign Experience.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，懲罰性國家賠償的域外經驗與借鏡。

sentences.english: Every failure or success is a glimpse into the future.
sentences.chinese: 生命裏，每一次的成敗都是未來的借鏡。

sentences.english: Dongsha marine park could be a model for how to handle other disputed islets.
sentences.chinese: 東沙環礁國家公園也許可以作爲其他爭議之島的借鏡。

sentences.english: You can borrow from my experience in learning German.
sentences.chinese: 我自已學德語的經歷可以給你們借鏡。

definition: bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
highest common factor HCF/greatest common divisor GCD
